title: How to Make Peanut Butter Cup Infused Vodka

steps.headline: Find a suitable container or jug.
steps.description: Remember that you'll need room for the amount of candy and vodka. If you're making a small batch, a quart sized Tupperware container is doable. Larger batches may require several wide-mouthed mason jars.

steps.headline: Measure your peanut butter cups and add it to the container.
steps.description: Cut the cups in half, to allow the vodka to seep in and bring out the peanut butter flavor faster.

steps.headline: Measure the vodka.
steps.description: Carefully pour the vodka on top of the chocolate.

steps.headline: Securely tighten the lid.
steps.description: Jiggle the container around so that the contents can mix together a little.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to infuse for a week.
steps.description: Assist the process by shaking the container every now and again. The best place for storage would be in a dark, but cool place so that it wouldn't be disturbed as much.

steps.headline: Strain the mixture.
steps.description: You will want to get all the solids and sugars separated from the liquor as much as possible. If you don't have a metal strainer, a simple cheesecloth or coffee filter will do. Repeat straining after all chocolate have been strained.

steps.headline: Store the mixture.
steps.description: If you're not using this immediately, chill it in the refrigerator until needed.
